Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Public Health and Sanitary Service buildings[ENDCOLOR] can increase the city's population growth speed by filling the [ICON_FOOD] Food growth slot after a new [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen is born. However they are not Fod Production buildings. They cannot directly boost the city's [ICON_FOOD] Food output.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Public Health and Sanitary Service buildings can also reduce the [ICON_FOOD] Food growth loss due to pollution in the city. However, they cannot completely remove the pollution but only to ease the problem.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Public Health and Sanitary Service buildings are designed to make the large cities to grow even larger, or fight against pollution. As a result, they must be built in cities reached the certain population size level. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These buildings will cost additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold for maintenance according to the city's population.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Basic Buildings[ENDCOLOR] are the most common buildings to be built in your city to increase the all kinds of city's output or provide specialist slot for citizens to work. These buildings can be built in cities at any population size level. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Most of them require a certain amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold for maintenance. Some industrial buildings may even casue [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Pollution[ENDCOLOR] - Pollution will slow down the city's population growth. To solve the pollution problem, you should consider building [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Public Health and Sanitary Service buildings[ENDCOLOR].

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Advance Buildings[ENDCOLOR] must be built in cities reached the certain population size level, which means you are not allowed to build these buildings in a city with low population. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The buildings can offer great bonus accroding to the city's resources and population. Some of them can even provide additional happiness or resources.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Public Transport Buildings[ENDCOLOR] are designed to hadle the traffic problems in large city. As a result, they can greatly improve the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production output in the city by reducing people's commute time. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Public Transport Buildings must be built in cities reached the certain population size level. Also they will cost a large amount of [ICON_GOLD] Gold for maintenance. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Fortunately, you can also earn additional [ICON_GOLD] Gold by tickets fee.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Buildings[ENDCOLOR] allows the city to build certain kinds of military units. most of they can also improve the city's defense. These buildings can be built in cities at any population size level.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Power Plant Buildings[ENDCOLOR] can produce [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity resource to keep your city functioning. Some buildings also require a certain amount of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity to build. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These buildings can be built in cities at any population size level. However, most Power Plant Buildings require strategic resources to build and will cause [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Pollution[ENDCOLOR] - Pollution will slow down the city's population growth. To solve the pollution problem, you should consider building [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Public Health and Sanitary Service buildings[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You must always have enough Power Plant Buildings to make your empire run. Because affter entering the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Modern Era[ENDCOLOR]. Your cities will consume [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity accrodign to their population size. If your empire is lacking of [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity, the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_GOLD] Gold output will greatly decrease nationwide. Otherwise, if you have abundant [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity, you will receive bonus for the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_GOLD] Gold output nationwide.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]City Hall Buildings[ENDCOLOR] will indicate the city's corruption and public security condition. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The corruption and public security condition in a city are determined by the distance between the city and your [ICON_CAPITAL]Capital. If the city is too far from your [ICON_CAPITAL]Capital, it will require more Consumer Goods and suffer from corruption and public security problems, which will cause additional [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and increase the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture Cost for applying new Policies.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can reduce the corruption and public security problems by building the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Anti-corruption and Public Security Buildings[ENDCOLOR]. However you have to pay the expensive maintenance fee. Otherwise, you may consider selling the City Hall Building to make the city [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Puppet[ENDCOLOR]. Puppet cities won't create any corruption and public security issues but its output is lower and the population growth is slower than normal cities.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Admin Buildings[ENDCOLOR] help you to deal with the city's corruption and public security issues in distanct cities. These buildings can be built in cities at any population size level. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These buildings will cost you a lot of extra [ICON_GOLD] Gold for maintenance fee, so make sure they worth the cost!
City Size(I): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_TOWN][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Village[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Village[ENDCOLOR] is a small settlement. It is sparsely populated, and has weak defences. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 3 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 6 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 3 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 3 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Minimal Traffic and Pollution Problems[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades to [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_SMALL][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Town[ENDCOLOR] when the [ICON_CITIZEN]Population reaches 6
City Size(II): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_SMALL][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Town[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Town[ENDCOLOR] is a compactly settled area usually larger than a village but smaller than a city. The foundations of industry and culture are laid as the settlement expands. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 4 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 6 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 6 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 6 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 8 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades to [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_MEDIUM][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]City[ENDCOLOR] when the [ICON_CITIZEN]Population reaches 15
City Size(III): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_MEDIUM][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]City[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]City[ENDCOLOR] is a permanent and densely settled location, with administratively defined boundaries whose members work primarily on non-agricultural tasks. They serve as centers of Industry, Culture and Science. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 4 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 15 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 12 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 12 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 4 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 16 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades to [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LARGE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Municipality[ENDCOLOR] when the [ICON_CITIZEN]Population reaches 26
City Size(IV): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LARGE][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Municipality[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Municipality[ENDCOLOR] is a large administrative division having corporate status and powers of self-government or jurisdiction as granted by national and regional laws to which it is subordinate. Development is heavily concentrated, and lays the groundwork for even more growth potential. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 4 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 26 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 25 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 25 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 8 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 35 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades to [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_XL][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Metropolis[ENDCOLOR] when the [ICON_CITIZEN]Population reaches 40
City Size(V): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_XL][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Metropolis[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Metropolis[ENDCOLOR] is an urban region, which is a significant economic, political, and cultural center for a country or region, and an important hub for regional or international connections, commerce, and communications. With one foot in the past and one foot in the future, Metropolises are a symbol of human endurance and progress. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 5 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 40 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 50 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 50 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 16 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 75 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_STORED]Global Prominence[ENDCOLOR] increases [ICON_TOURISM]Tourism by 15% [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrades to [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_XXL][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Megapolis[ENDCOLOR] when the [ICON_CITIZEN]Population reaches 60
City Size(VI): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_XXL][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Megapolis[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Megapolis[ENDCOLOR] is a thickly populated region centering in a metropolis or embracing several Metropolises. As multiple Metropolises merge into one, the resonance effect of dense population leads to exponentially more productive urban regions. The population of entire countries may inhabit such regions, rising crime and stratification of society leads to massive wealth inequality if not actively prevented. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 5 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 60 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 75 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 75 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 32 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 100 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_STORED]Global Prominence[ENDCOLOR] increases [ICON_TOURISM]Tourism by 25% [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Social Stratification increases[ENDCOLOR] the [ICON_CULTURE]Culture cost for future Policies by +5%. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Upgrade to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Global City[ENDCOLOR] when the popluation reaches 80.
City Size(VII): [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_GLOBAL][COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Gigapolis[ENDCOLOR]

A [COLOR_SELECTED_TEXT]Gigapolis[ENDCOLOR] is an amalgamation of Urban regions, combining the populations of many multiple settlements that rival the population of subcontinents. Urban dwellings reach kilometers into the sky, as sunlight becomes a luxury commodity in this dystopian construct. Arms and Limbs slave away in the underground Megafactories, and it is said a Gigapolis can manufacture more goods than entire Nation-States of past. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Citizens [ICON_WORKER]Working Range of this city: 5 Tiles [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Provides[ENDCOLOR] 80 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 120 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY]Electricity [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Consumes[ENDCOLOR] 120 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Traffic and Pollution[ENDCOLOR] cause 64 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_GREEN]Tarrifs generate[ENDCOLOR] 150 [ICON_INVEST]GPT per [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE]Trade Route [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_CULTURE_STORED]Global Prominence[ENDCOLOR] increases [ICON_TOURISM]Tourism by 50% [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Social Stratification increases[ENDCOLOR] the [ICON_CULTURE]Culture cost for future Policies by +5%. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]As the Population of entire Subcontinents coalesce into this settlement, it has become a living, breathing Wonder in its own right. Our ancient ancestors may only wonder why we replaced their breathing blue skies for constricting concrete ones...
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV1] Core City[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV1]Core Cities form part of the Core Territory of a Civilization. This is the very heartland, and the lands comprising the origin of its great journey. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]The [ICON_PUPPET]Local Administration is under the direct purview of [ICON_CAPITAL]Central Administration and Bureaucrats [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 0 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 0 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 16 [ICON_GOLD]GPT [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Causes[ENDCOLOR] 0 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you sell the City Hall Building, this City will become a [ICON_PUPPET]Puppet but will suffer a period of[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE]Resistance[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2] Provincial City[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2]Provincial Cities are auxillary cities, often built as a Civilization expands, and to support and defend Core Territory. [NEWLINE]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 6 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 4 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 32 [ICON_GOLD]GPT [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Causes[ENDCOLOR] 4 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you sell the City Hall Building, this City will become a [ICON_PUPPET]Puppet but will suffer a period of[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE]Resistance[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV3] Territorial City[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV3]Territorial Cities are often newly settled cities, on the edges of Civilization. These cities are often far enough from the Capital to cause Bureaucratic issues. [NEWLINE]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 12 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 8 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 64 [ICON_GOLD]GPT [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Causes[ENDCOLOR] 16 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you sell the City Hall Building, this City will become a [ICON_PUPPET]Puppet but will suffer a period of[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE]Resistance[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV4] Colonial City[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV4]Colonial Cities are far flung cities, that are often disconnected from the Core Territories. These Cities may be of immense strategic value, however they suffer from Bureaucratic issues until better Communication Technology is invented. [NEWLINE]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 24 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 16 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 128 [ICON_GOLD]GPT [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Causes[ENDCOLOR] 32 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you sell the City Hall Building, this City will become a [ICON_PUPPET]Puppet but will suffer a period of[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE]Resistance[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV5] Peripheral City[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV5]Peripheral Cities are not viewed as viable inhabitations except in special cases, and cause Bureaucratic and Monetary strain on a Civilization. These may hold massive Strategic value and often server as Military Bases. [NEWLINE]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 48 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER]Manpower [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 32 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER]Consumer Goods [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Requires[ENDCOLOR] 200 [ICON_GOLD]GPT [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Causes[ENDCOLOR] 32 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you sell the City Hall Building, this City will become a [ICON_PUPPET]Puppet but will suffer a period of[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT][ICON_RESISTANCE]Resistance[ENDCOLOR]

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2][COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Provincial City[ENDCOLOR] ([ICON_PUPPET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Local Administration[ENDCOLOR]) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This City is currently administered by an inefficient [ICON_PUPPET]Local Administration.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]There are minor Corruption and Public Security problems in this city, which cause +1% extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness! [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Build a [COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Constabulary[ENDCOLOR] to eliminate the Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness!

[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV3][COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Territorial City[ENDCOLOR] ([ICON_PUPPET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Local Administration[ENDCOLOR]) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This City is currently administered by an inefficient [ICON_PUPPET]Local Administration.[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]There are major Corruption and Public Security problems in this city, which cause +2% extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness! [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Build a [COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Sheriffs Office[ENDCOLOR] to eliminate the Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness!

[COLOR_YIELD_FOOD][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV4]Colonial City[ENDCOLOR] ([ICON_PUPPET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Local Administration[ENDCOLOR]) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This City is currently administered by an inefficient [ICON_PUPPET]Local Administration.[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]There are major Corruption and Public Security problems in this city, which cause +3% extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness! [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Build a [COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Police Station[ENDCOLOR] to eliminate the Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness!

[COLOR_YIELD_FOOD][ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV5]Peripheral City[ENDCOLOR] ([ICON_PUPPET][COLOR_FONT_RED]Local Administration[ENDCOLOR]) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This City is currently administered by an inefficient [ICON_PUPPET]Local Administration.[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]There are major Corruption and Public Security problems in this city, which cause +3% extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness! [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Build a [COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Provac[ENDCOLOR] to eliminate the Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4]Unhappiness!
[ICON_PUPPET] City Hall

[ICON_BULLET]This city is a Puppet. It is free from Corruption and Public Security problems, however provides much lower resources. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Consume 4 [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]NO[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower is provided. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As a puppet city, -33% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture output, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output and -50% [ICON_FOOD] Food Growth. Also, You cannot control the city's production.
[ICON_PUPPET] Palazzo Ducale

[ICON_BULLET]This city is a Puppet City owned by Venice. It is free from Corruption and Public Security problems. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+4 [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Consume No [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Consumer Goods. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]-50% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost for acquiring new Tiles. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Provides full [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science and [ICON_FOOD] Growth .

Replace.Text: [ICON_CITY_STATE] Courthouse
Eliminates extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from an [ICON_OCCUPIED] Occupied City. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2] Constabulary

Can only be built in in [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2]Provincial Cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eliminates extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness caused by Corruption and Public Security problems. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 6 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Row.Text: [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2] Senate

The Roman Senate was a political institution in ancient Rome. It was one of the most enduring institutions in Roman history, being established in the first days of the city (traditionally founded in 753 BC). It survived the overthrow of the kings in 509 BC, the fall of the Roman Republic in the 1st century BC, the division of the Roman Empire in 395 AD, the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 AD, and the barbarian rule of Rome in the 5th, 6th, and 7th centuries.

Can only be built in [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV2]Provincial Cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eliminates extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness caused by Corruption and Public Security problems. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Elimate the extra [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of adopting new Policies created by Lv2 Cities (stacked with the "Representation" Policy effect) . [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 6 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.
[ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV3] Sheriffs Office

Can only be built in in [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV3]Territorial Cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eliminates extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness caused by Corruption and Public Security problems. Lower the increasing [ICON_CULTURE] Culture Cost for adopting new Policies by this city to 10%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 5 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

In principle, a Sheriff is a legal official with responsibility for a "shire", i.e. county. In practice, the specific combination of legal, political and ceremonial duties of a sheriff varies greatly from country to country.

Replace.Text: [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV4] Police Station

Can only be built in in [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV4]Colonial Cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eliminates extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness caused by Corruption and Public Security problems. Lower the increasing [ICON_CULTURE] Culture Cost for adopting new Policies by this city to 25%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

Row.Text: [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV5] Consulate

Can only be built in in [ICON_CITYBANNER_CITY_LV5]Peripheral Cities. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Eliminates extra Nationwide [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness caused by Corruption and Public Security problems. Lower the increasing [ICON_CULTURE] Culture Cost for adopting new Policies by this city to 25%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pay extra 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 3 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population.

The judicial branch is one of three branches of government in the People's Republic of China, along with the executive and legislative branches. Strictly speaking, it refers to the activities of the People's Court system. The Chinese court system is based on civil law modeled after the legal systems of Germany and France, but with local characteristics.
[COLOR_YIELD_FOOD]Current Manpower Condition[ENDCOLOR]
You have enough [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] -33% [ICON_GOLD] Gold Cost for purchasing Buildings and Units due to the lower Human resources cost.
You have enough [ICON_RES_MANPOWER] Manpower! [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] -15% [ICON_GOLD] Gold Cost for purchasing Buildings and Units due to the lower Human resources cost.

Coal is the most abundant fossil fuel on the planet. It is a relatively cheap fuel, with some of the largest deposits in regions that are relatively stable politically, such as China, India and the United States. This contrasts with natural gas and petroleum, the largest deposits of which are located in the politically volatile Persian Gulf.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Coal Plant Additional Unit
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Pollution[ENDCOLOR] will cause -10% [ICON_FOOD] Food Growth.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Coal Plant.

Denmark was a pioneer in developing commercial wind power during the 1970s, and today a substantial share of the wind turbines around the world are produced by Danish manufacturers such as Vestas and Siemens Wind Power along with many component suppliers.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Wind Turbine
+4 [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Electricity. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Pollution[ENDCOLOR]

A wind turbine is a device that converts kinetic energy from the wind into electrical power. The term appears to have migrated from parallel hydroelectric technology (rotary propeller). The technical description for this type of machine is an aerofoil-powered generator.

Replace.Text: [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Hydro Plant

[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Pollution[ENDCOLOR] will cause -15% [ICON_FOOD] Food Growth. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Small Cities.

One type of fossil fuel power plant uses a gas turbine in conjunction with a heat recovery steam generator (HRSG). It is referred to as a combined cycle power plant because it combines the Brayton cycle of the gas turbine with the Rankine cycle of the HRSG. The thermal efficiency of these plants has reached a record heat rate of 5690 Btu/(kW·h), or just under 60%, at a facility in Baglan Bay, Wales.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Gas Plant
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Pollution[ENDCOLOR] will cause -10% [ICON_FOOD] Food Growth. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Small Cities.

Natural gas showed a corresponding jump, increasing by a third over 2011. Some coal power plants such as the 1200 MW Hearn Generating Station have stopped burning coal by switching the plant to natural gas. Coal's share of electricity generation dropped to just over 36%. Natural gas accounted for 81% of new power generation in the US between 2000 and 2010.

Row.Text: [ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] PS10 Solar Power Plant
No Pollution and No terrain requirements.

The PS10 Solar Power Plant (Spanish: Planta Solar 10), is the world's first commercial concentrating solar power tower operating near Seville, in Andalusia, Spain. The 11 megawatt (MW) solar power tower produces electricity with 624 large movable mirrors called heliostats.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Tidal Plant
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Pollution[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be constructed in a costal city.
Tidal power, also called tidal energy, is a form of hydropower that converts the energy obtained from tides into useful forms of power, mainly electricity.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Dynamic Tidal Plant

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Pollution[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every water tiles worked by the city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be constructed in a costal city.

ynamic tidal power or DTP is an untried but promising technology for tidal power generation. It would involve creating a long dam-like structure perpendicular to the coast, with the option for a coast-parallel barrier at the far end, forming a large 'T' shape. The concept was invented and patented in 1997 by Dutch coastal engineers Kees Hulsbergen and Rob Steijn.
[ICON_RES_ELECTRICITY] Nuclear Fusion Plant
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]No Pollution[ENDCOLOR] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Large Cities.

In nuclear physics, nuclear fusion is a nuclear reaction in which two or more atomic nuclei come very close and then collide at a very high speed and join to form a new nucleus. The mass of this new nucleus is slightly less than the sum of its constituents, by an amount known as the "binding energy".

Superconductivity is a phenomenon of exactly zero electrical resistance and expulsion of magnetic flux fields occurring in certain materials when cooled below a characteristic critical temperature.

Row.Text: [ICON_FOOD] Basilica Cistern

The Basilica Cistern (Turkish: Yerebatan Sarayı - "Sunken Palace", or Yerebatan Sarnıcı - "Sunken Cistern"), is the largest of several hundred ancient cisterns that lie beneath the city of Istanbul (formerly Constantinople), Turkey. The cistern, located 500 feet (150 m) southwest of the Hagia Sophia on the historical peninsula of Sarayburnu, was built in the 6th century during the reign of Byzantine Emperor Justinian I.

Tap water (running water, city water, municipal water, etc.) is water supplied to a tap (valve). Its uses include drinking, washing, cooking, and the flushing of toilets. Indoor tap water is distributed through "indoor plumbing", which has existed since antiquity but was available to very few people until the second half of the 19th century when it began to propagate in what are now developed countries.
[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Racecourse

A racetrack is a permanent facility or building. Racecourse is an alternate term for a horse racing track, found in countries such as the United Kingdom, Australia, Hong Kong, and the United Arab Emirates. Race tracks built for bicycles are known as velodromes. Circuit is a common alternate term for racetrack, given the usual circuitous configuration of most race tracks, allowing races to occur over several laps.

[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Kallimarmaro

The Panathenaic Stadium (Greek: Παναθηναϊκό στάδιο), also known as the Kallimármaro (Καλλιμάρμαρο, meaning the "beautifully marbled"), is a multi-purpose stadium used for several events and athletics in Athens. The Stadium hosted the first modern Olympic Games in 1896.

Row.Text: [ICON_RES_CONSUMER] Supermarket

A supermarket, a large form of the traditional grocery store, is a self-service shop offering a wide variety of food and household products, organized into aisles. It is larger and has a wider selection than a traditional grocery store, but is smaller and more limited in the range of merchandise than a hypermarket or big-box market.

Row.Text: [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Irish Pub

An Irish pub is an establishment licensed to serve alcoholic drinks for consumption on the premises. They are characterized by a unique culture centred around a casual and friendly atmosphere, hearty food and drink, Irish sports, and traditional Irish music. Their widespread appeal has led to the Irish pub theme spreading around the world.

[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Wildlife Preserve

A wildlife preserve is a protected area of importance for wildlife, flora or fauna, which is reserved and managed for conservation and to provide special opportunities for study or research. Nature reserves may be designated by government institutions in some countries, or by private landowners, such as charities and research institutions, regardless of nationality. Nature reserves fall into different IUCN categories depending on the level of protection afforded by local laws.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Organized whale watching dates back to 1950 when the Cabrillo National Monument in San Diego was declared a public venue for observing Gray Whales. In 1955 the first water-based whale watching commenced in the same area, charging customers $1 per trip to view the whales at closer quarters. Today whale watching is estimated to be worth up to $2.1 billion per annum worldwide to whale watching operations, employing around 13,000 workers. The size and rapid growth of the industry has led to complex and continuing debates with the whaling industry about the best use of whales as a natural resource.

[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Jeweler

Jewelry is a form of personal adornment, manifesting itself as necklaces, rings, brooches, earrings and bracelets. Jewelry may be made from any material, usually gemstones, precious metals or shells. Factors affecting the choice of materials include cultural differences and the availability of the materials. Jewelry may be appreciated because of its material properties, its patterns or for meaningful symbols. Jewelry differs from other items of personal adornment in that it has no other purpose than to look appealing.

Row.Text: [ICON_PRODUCTION] Stagecoach

A stagecoach is a type of covered wagon used to carry passengers and goods inside. It is strongly sprung and generally drawn by four horses, usually four-in-hand. Widely used before the introduction of railway transport, it made regular trips between stages or stations, which were places of rest provided for stagecoach travelers. The business of running stagecoaches or the act of journeying in them was known as staging.

[ICON_PRODUCTION] Bus Station

A bus station is a structure where city or intercity buses stop to pick up and drop off passengers. It is larger than a bus stop, which is usually simply a place on the roadside, where buses can stop. It may be intended as a terminal station for a number of routes, or as a transfer station where the routes continue.

[ICON_PRODUCTION] Autobahn

The Autobahn (German: Autobahn, plural Autobahnen) is the federal controlled-access highway system in Germany. The official German term is Bundesautobahn (plural Bundesautobahnen, abbreviated BAB), which translates as "federal motorway". The literal meaning of the word Bundesautobahn is "Federal Auto(mobile) Track".

[ICON_PRODUCTION] Grand Canal

The Grand Canal (Italian: Canal grande [kaˈnal ˈɡrande], Venetian: Canałasso [kanaˈɰaso]) is a canal in Venice, Italy. It forms one of the major water-traffic corridors in the city. Public transport is provided by water buses (Italian: vaporetti) and private water taxis, and many tourists explore the canal by gondola.

[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Bullring

A bullring is an arena where bullfighting is performed. Bullrings are often associated with Spain, but they can also be found in neighboring countries and the New World. Bullrings are often historic and culturally significant centres that bear many structural similarities to the Roman amphitheatre.

Row.Text: [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Chinese Garden

The Chinese garden is a landscape garden style which has evolved over three thousand years. It includes both the vast gardens of the Chinese emperors and members of the imperial family, built for pleasure and to impress, and the more intimate gardens created by scholars, poets, former government officials, soldiers and merchants, made for reflection and escape from the outside world. They create an idealized miniature landscape, which is meant to express the harmony that should exist between man and nature.

[ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Hall of Worthies

The Hall of Worthies, or Jiphyeonjeon, was a royal research institute set up by Sejong the Great of the Korean Joseon Dynasty in March 1420. Set up during the beginning of his reign, King Sejong staffed the Hall of Worthies with talented scholars and instructed them to conduct a variety of research activities to strengthen his rule and the nation.

[ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Cable Network

Cable Internet is a form of broadband Internet access that uses the cable television infrastructure. Like digital subscriber line and fiber to the premises services, cable Internet access provides network edge connectivity (last mile access) from the Internet service provider to an end user. It is integrated into the cable television infrastructure analogously to DSL which uses the existing telephone network. Cable TV networks and telecommunications networks are the two predominant forms of residential Internet access. Recently, both have seen increased competition from fiber deployments, wireless, and mobile networks.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Cable television is a system of providing television to consumers via radio frequency signals transmitted to televisions through fixed optical fibers or coaxial cables located on the subscriber's property, much like the over-the-air method used in traditional television broadcasting (via radio waves) in which a television antenna is required. FM radio programming, high-speed Internet, telephony, and similar non-television services may also be provided. The major difference is the change of radio frequency signals used and optical connections to the subscriber property.

[ICON_PRODUCTION] Subway Station

A metro station or subway station is a railway station for a rapid transit system, often known by names such as "metro", "underground" and "subway". Such a station can be elevated, underground, or about ground level depending on the level of the train tracks.

[ICON_PRODUCTION] Maglev

Maglev (derived from magnetic levitation) is a transport method that uses magnetic levitation to move vehicles without touching the ground. With maglev, a vehicle travels along a guideway using magnets to create both lift and propulsion, thereby reducing friction by a great extent and allowing very high speeds.
+25% [ICON_PRODUCTION] for the city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold for every 4 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the city as ticket fees. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built in Global Cities.

A theme park can be regarded as a distinct style of amusement park. A theme park has landscaping, buildings, and attractions that are based on one or more specific themes or stories.

Row.Text: [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Brazilian Football Pitch

Association Football is the most popular sport in Brazil. The Brazilian national football team has won the FIFA World Cup tournament a record five times, in 1958, 1962, 1970, 1994 and 2002, and is the only team to succeed in qualifying for every World Cup competition ever held.

[ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Video Game Company

A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device such as a TV screen or computer monitor. The word video in video game traditionally referred to a raster display device, but in the 2000s, it implies any type of display device that can produce two- or three-dimensional images. Video games are sometimes believed to be a form of art, but this designation is controversial.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The first Sid Meier's Civilization was created by Sid Meier and Bruce Shelley for MicroProse in 1991. Sid Meier's Civilization has been called one of the most important strategy games of all time.

Row.Text: [ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Bollywood

Bollywood is the sobriquet for the Hindi language film industry based in Mumbai, the most populous city of the Republic of India. The term is often loosely used as a synecdoche to refer to the whole of Indian cinema; however, Bollywood proper is only a part of the large Indian film industry, which includes other production centres producing films in many languages.
+33% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The empire will immediately enter a Golden Age everytime when a Bollywood is built.
